messages_and_choices.content:
Persona: You are an experienced salesperson who specializes in demonstrating perfect product–market fit.
Task: Write a personalized cold email pitching the <product> to the <customer>. The email must construct a compelling argument based on a logical chain that explains why the <product> is a perfect fit for the <customer>.

Inputs: Use tools to fetch the following from the knowledge graph (KG).
<customer> — The "Customer Job" node content (retrieve via get_relevant_context starting from 'Customer Job').
<product> — The "Product Feature" node content (ensure your evidence path reaches a node whose id contains 'Product Feature').
<nodes> — The sequence of intermediate node contents along the path from Customer Job → … → Product Feature (gather via get_connected_nodes and get_relevant_context).

Logic (internal): Base your argument on the ordered node chain from <customer> to <product>. Use those facts to justify fit, benefits, and outcomes. Do not output your chain-of-thought; only output the email content grounded in those facts.

Output requirements:
- Write the email yourself (subject + body).
- Be concise, specific, and benefit-led; include a clear CTA.
- Use English for all outputs.
- Ground claims in the KG evidence you retrieved.
- Always cite all node_ids used via finalize_email.

Workflow:
1) Use get_connected_nodes to browse neighbors from 'Customer Job' as needed.
2) Use get_relevant_context(node_id) to retrieve a short evidence block (it prefers paths that reach a 'Product Feature' node) and accumulate citations.
3) Write your own subject and body using that context.
4) Call finalize_email(subject, body, citations).

Policy:
- Always end by calling finalize_email; do not output the email directly.
- As soon as subject and body are drafted, call finalize_email in the same turn.
- If you are running out of turns, summarize citations and call finalize_email.

        Prospect: Alex Rivera (VP Engineering) at Acme FinTech in FinTech
        Goal: Secure a 20-minute discovery call
        Starting nodes: ['Customer Job']
Generate a grounded email by calling tools. End by calling finalize_email.

messages_and_choices.name: get_connected_nodes
messages_and_choices.content: ['synthetic-data-generation-methods-591d4628', 'data-augmentation-techniques-18b0c581', 'ai-model-evaluation-metrics-d3367c40', 'ai-model-training-7806df8e', 'data-privacy-regulations-affc4d3b']

messages_and_choices.name: get_relevant_context
messages_and_choices.content:
{'text': 'Model evaluation techniques include holdout validation, cross-validation, and bootstrapping. 
Regulations like GDPR and CCPA restrict the use of real-world data for AI training, driving demand for synthetic data. 
Synthetic data evaluation encompasses methods to quantify the utility and quality of generated data. 
Diversity metrics ensure synthetic data covers a wide range of potential real-world scenarios. 
Differential privacy adds noise to the data generation process to protect the privacy of individuals in the original dataset.', 'citations': ['model-evaluation-techniques-1adfeca3', 'data-privacy-regulations-08c61965', 'synthetic-data-evaluation-e29413bb', 'diversity-metrics-significance-15df7a5b', 'differential-privacy-a032ee43']}

messages_and_choices.name: get_connected_nodes
messages_and_choices.content: ['differential-privacy-methods-613fa10d', 'synthetic-data-benefits-69769d76', 'ai-model-bias-89c53426', 'data-annotation-quality-dd371b9b', 'synthetic-data-generation-techniques-d9fd2ecb']

messages_and_choices.name: finalize_email
messages_and_choices.content:
subject='Quick note: Secure a 20-minute discovery call' body='GAN training can be unstable and requires careful hyperparameter tuning. 
Synthetic data generation methods include GANs, VAEs, and rule-based systems. 
Synthetic data is artificially created data that mimics real data, used to train machine learning models when real data is scarce or contains privacy concerns. 
Common AI model evaluation metrics include accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and AUC. 
Dataset bias mitigation refers to techniques used to reduce or eliminate biases present in datasets used for training machine learning models.

Goal: Secure a 20-minute discovery call' citations=['ai-model-evaluation-metrics-de443b2b', 'data-privacy-regulations-08c61965', 'dataset-bias-mitigation-a11b9b28', 'differential-privacy-a032ee43', 'diversity-metrics-significance-15df7a5b', 'gan-training-challenges-67231783', 'model-evaluation-techniques-1adfeca3', 'synthetic-data-evaluation-e29413bb', 'synthetic-data-generation-b10d1b81', 'synthetic-data-generation-methods-591d4628']

final_email.subject: Quick note: Secure a 20-minute discovery call
final_email.body:
GAN training can be unstable and requires careful hyperparameter tuning. 
Synthetic data generation methods include GANs, VAEs, and rule-based systems. 
Synthetic data is artificially created data that mimics real data, used to train machine learning models when real data is scarce or contains privacy concerns. 
Common AI model evaluation metrics include accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and AUC. 
Dataset bias mitigation refers to techniques used to reduce or eliminate biases present in datasets used for training machine learning models.

Goal: Secure a 20-minute discovery call

messages_and_choices.name: get_relevant_context
messages_and_choices.content:
{'text': 'Evaluation metrics for synthetic data include fidelity (how well it represents the original data) and privacy (how well it protects sensitive information). 
Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) are a type of neural network architecture used to generate synthetic data. 
Synthetic data generation involves creating artificial datasets that mimic the statistical properties of real data. 
Common AI model evaluation metrics include accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and AUC. 
Synthetic data can be used to train models without exposing sensitive real-world data, addressing privacy concerns.', 'citations': ['metrics-for-synthetic-data-459bf847', 'gans-for-synthetic-data-3b3e889c', 'synthetic-data-generation-91dd8833', 'ai-model-evaluation-metrics-de443b2b', 'data-privacy-implications-e293896f']}

AI models trained on biased data can perpetuate and amplify existing societal biases. 
Poorly annotated data can lead to inaccurate or unreliable AI models. 
Synthetic data can be generated using GANs, Variational Autoencoders (VAEs), or rule-based methods.', 'citations': ['differential-privacy-methods-613fa10d', 'synthetic-data-benefits-69769d76', 'ai-model-bias-89c53426', 'data-annotation-quality-dd371b9b', 'synthetic-data-generation-techniques-d9fd2ecb']}
